justification: "PRL paradigms therefore provide a direct assessment of flexible choice behavior" and participants "completed a computerized probabilistic reversal learning (PRL) task" to index this construct.

measured_by: Autism Diagnostic Interview-Revised (ADI-R) RRB algorithm score
justification: "Two measures were used to assess RRB symptom severity in ASD: (i) The Autism Diagnostic Interview-Revised (ADI-R)… which yields an algorithm score for RRB".

measured_by: Repetitive Behavior Scale-Revised (RBS-R) Ritualistic-Sameness & Stereotyped Behavior subscales
justification: The authors state that the "Repetitive Behavior Scale-Revised (RBS-R)… typically yields a total score and five subscales. Here we use the Ritualistic-Sameness and Stereotyped Behavior subscales as the best indices of behavioral rigidity."
"To examine whether relationships were specific to RRB, ADI-R domain scores for Communication and Reciprocal Social Interaction were included."

measured_by: Social Responsiveness Scale-2nd Edition (SRS-2) Social Communication Index
justification: The methods note inclusion of "T-scores for the Social Communication Index on the Social Responsiveness Scale-2nd Edition (SRS-2)… a parent-report questionnaire assessing current social-communication difficulties."

measured_by: DSM-5 ADHD Rating Scale (parent- and self-report forms)
justification: "The DSM-5 rating scale of ADHD was used to assess associated symptoms… parents of all ASD participants completed the parent-report form and… ASD adults completed the self-report form."
"For anxiety, adult participants completed the BAI in self-report form."

measured_by: Beck Youth Inventories–Second Edition (BYI-II) Anxiety subscale
justification: "Adolescents completed the self-report version of the anxiety subscale of the Beck Youth Inventories (BYI-II). Parents/caregivers of children completed the same BYI-II subscale in parent-report form."
Participant characteristics note that "Full-scale IQ was measured using the Wechsler scales (see [41])."
